titles: The love-sick lady: being her sorrowful sighs for her loyal soldier, whom at length she enjoy'd to her unspeakable satisfaction. Tune of, What shall I do to show how much I love her. Licensed according to orde[r].
publisher: Printed for P. Brooksby, J. Deacon, J. Blare. J. Back,
notes: Verse: "Near a fair fountain a damsel sat weeping ..."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
